name: Muslim Bar Association of New York
mission: TO ORGANIZE AND REPRESENT MUSLIM ATTORNEYS IN THE NEW YORK AREA AND TO ADVANCE THE GOALS, NEEDS AND INTERESTS THEREOF,AND IMPROVE THE POSITION OF THE MU...
zakatClaimEvidence: The official website and 'About Us' sections of the Muslim Bar Association of New York (MuBANY) do not contain any explicit mention of accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or campaigns. Their stated mission focuses on organizing and representing Muslim attorneys, improving the position of the Muslim community through advocacy and education, and facilitating professional development.

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Bar Association of New Yorkinc shows moderate impact and moderate alignment. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: The official website and 'About Us' sections of the Muslim Bar Association of New York (MuBANY) do not contain any explicit mention of accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or campaigns. Their stated mission focuses on organizing and representing Muslim attorneys, improving the position of the Muslim community through advocacy and education, and facilitating professional development.

all_citations.claim: The organization organizes and represents Muslim attorneys in New York and operates mentorship and gala programs.
The organization reported total revenue of $93,638 and holds 9.0 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a score of 40/100, reflecting a stable financial position but limited public data regarding the direct impact and efficiency of its programs.
areas_for_improvement: Limited transparency regarding program expense ratios and fundraising efficiency metrics.
Low data confidence due to a lack of detailed third-party impact verification.

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a professional association, the organization offers a specific domestic focus, though it may have lower alignment for donors seeking direct poverty relief or high-urgency humanitarian aid [1]. Contributions are considered sadaqah-eligible for those looking to support professional community development [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building within the legal profession through mentorship and networking [1]. While it holds 9.0 months of working capital, the lack of a reported program expense ratio makes it difficult to assess the direct financial efficiency of its service delivery [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim Bar Association of New York serves as a professional hub for Muslim legal professionals, fostering mentorship and advocacy within the New York legal community.
strengths: holds 9.0 months of working capital, providing a stable financial cushion for operations.
Established presence in the New York legal community through specialized programming and networking events.
baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim Bar Association of New York is a professional organization dedicated to representing and advancing the interests of Muslim attorneys in the New York area [1]. The organization facilitates professional development through its Mentorship Program and hosts an Annual Gala and Awards Reception to recognize achievements within the legal field [1][2].
